com.google.android.agera

Annotation Type RepositoryConfig


  • @Retention(value=SOURCE)
public @interface RepositoryConfig
    Constants controlling some behaviors of the compiled Repositorys.

    • Field Detail

      • CONTINUE_FLOW

        public static final int CONTINUE_FLOW
        If a data processing flow is ongoing, allow it to finish. If this is the configuration for the concurrent update, the new data processing flow will commence when the current one finishes. This is the default behavior and, with a value of 0, cannot be combined with other configurations.

      • CANCEL_FLOW

        public static final int CANCEL_FLOW
        If a data processing flow is ongoing, cancel it at the earliest opportunity, which is immediately after the currently running directive, or during it if SEND_INTERRUPT is used and the current operator (Function, Supplier, Merger etc.) has adequate support for the thread interruption signal. If this is the configuration for a repository, cancellation prevents the flow from updating the repository value, even if the last run directive would have set the new value otherwise. If this is the configuration for the concurrent update, the new data processing flow will commence as soon as the current one is terminated, effectively redoing the data processing from the start. This behavior is implicit if RESET_TO_INITIAL_VALUE or SEND_INTERRUPT is specified.

      • RESET_TO_INITIAL_VALUE

        public static final int RESET_TO_INITIAL_VALUE
        The repository value should reset to the initial value on deactivation. The reset is immediate while the data processing flow, if ongoing, may terminate only after the currently running directive. If this is the configuration for the concurrent update, the repository value will not be reset, but due to the included CANCEL_FLOW value, the ongoing flow will still be cancelled.

      • SEND_INTERRUPT

        public static final int SEND_INTERRUPT
        If a data processing flow is ongoing and in the asynchronous stage (after the first goTo directive and before the goLazy directive), interrupt the thread currently running the flow, to signal the current operator (function, supplier, merger etc.) to stop early. The interrupt signal will not be sent if the flow is in a synchronous stage, to minimize unwanted effects on the worker looper thread and the thread from which the client calls Supplier.get().
